attributes.action: Amend Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 and Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988
attributes.background: I am a scooter rider who has ridden to work, from Kew to Central London, each day for many many years...with no fines! I have recently received 4 speeding tickets in one week for marginally exceeding the speed limit on the A40.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe the punishments in such cases (SP 30) do not fit the crime. My suggestion is that the law is changed so that penalty points are allocated depending on the amount of the excess speed reached...for instance 1 penalty point for 5 mile per hour excess..2 penalty points for 10 miles per hour and so on.

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Put pressure on Bangladeshi government to improve road safety
attributes.background: In light of the recent events where two students were killed by a speeding driver,many students have been protesting for safer roads however they have been silenced by the police in the form of violence. Actions must be taken to ensure the safety of these people and to allow their voices to be heard

attributes.action: Make black plastic illegal
attributes.background: Currently in the UK only a third of plastic can be recycled. The public have been placing their plastic in the green bins completely unawares that most will end in landfill or incinerated. One of the quickest ways the Government can reduce this is to ban black plastic packaging.
attributes.additional_details: This featured as a main story on the BBC news on the 4th of August 2018.

attributes.action: To legally stagger school holidays in each county in England
attributes.background: The current holiday system for schools forces holiday prices up very high in current school hols as all parents want holidays at similar times. Spreading this demand out by schools having different weeks off would lower prices for families but shouldn’t affect holiday companies profit. Help!!
attributes.additional_details: This is an ongoing issue known by everyone. I think rather than sitting back and letting families struggle for years to take their kids away something should be done. It’s not feasible to ask holiday companies to change prices without demand changing and the only way that can change is the government changing school holidays in England. Help families. Don’t just accept how it is!!

attributes.action: change  personal injury law ,  anyone injured as a child can claim with no time
attributes.background: my sister in law was seriously burned when left unsupervised in a school playground when she was 7 yrs old. ( she is now 48 ) when her mother took her to a solicitor she was told unable to claim because she was a minor , the solicitor failed to inform her that she could claim when 18 until 21 .
attributes.additional_details:
when she tried to claim later in life she was told it was too late .
she was let down by the legal profession who failed to inform her of her rights. it is unacceptable that a child injured and unable to make 
informed decisions . and only have 3 years to report something.
when she has a lifetime of suffering .

attributes.action: To cap tax and national insurance on wages.
attributes.background:
There should be a cap on how many hours you should get taxed and insuranced on.
If you work under 22 hours get get tax free but if you work more you get taxed.
It doesn’t make sense the more hours you work the more tax you pay. As a person you don’t receive any extra.
attributes.additional_details:
If you work under 22 hours get get tax free but if you work more you get taxed.
It doesn’t make sense the more hours you work the more tax you pay. As a person you don’t receive any extra.I believe there should be a cap on how much tax and national insurance should be taken from your wages. If you work more then 45-50 hours a week, what you do  over should be tax and national insurance free. Personally I work 60-70 hour weeks and get tax an extortionate amount. Which works out I work 15-20 hours free because that’s how much goes to the groverment.
There should be a cap on tax and national insurance to make it fair for all those people that work those extra hours.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pedestrians to cross a road where a crossing is visible.
attributes.background: Too many RTA occur on the roads of England, with a majority of these being due to pedestrians crossing a road where a pedestrian crossing is accessible for them to use. Drivers are punished for stupidity of pedestrians! It’s illegal in the USA and I feel it should be here where a crossing is visible

attributes.action: Strip abusive parents of parental rights
attributes.background: Many parents are in impossible situations and have to meet face-to-face with an abuser who has parental rights. As soon as a parent is accused of such a thing, contact should be supervised and if convicted they should lose parental rights.
attributes.additional_details: I just want justice for all parents who have been abused mentally or physically, to give them chance to live.

attributes.action: Prevent requesting ID for energy drinks
attributes.background:
Due to recent media pressure, stores are now asking for ID for energy drinks. Energy drinks are a legal product, and most stores don't have the manpower or staffing availability to quickly serve their customers.
This behaviour should be stopped, driven as it is by a vocal segment of the population.

attributes.action: Increase organ donation by asking GP's to discuss the issue with their patients.
attributes.background:
I would like to raise awareness for organ donation to help those currently awaiting a transplant. At present, GP's do not ask patients whether they have ever considered donating their organs. 
I would like GP's to ask patients about organ donation as part of their routine medical appointments.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 7000 people are currently on the organ donation register awaiting a chance to improve their health and well-being. I am trying to increase awareness of the importance of organ donation across the UK and break down the stigma of having this crucial conversation. 
GP's play a vital role within our communities and have a close professional relationship with their patients, where discussions may be held freely. Please support my campaign to increase awareness and enrolment for organ donation.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for care services to be run as for profit companies
attributes.background: The way we treat our elder reflects the way that we as a society, are evolving. I have grown to experience the care sector in England in such a way that it is my firm belief that care services should only be run as community services funded by the people for the people.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a care worker who has worked in different services and supported people with many conditions, lifestyle and backgrounds; who has observed the national health and care crisis and increase in mental health in the the general population, leading to breakdown support networks for many people.
Being a firm believer that all people on Earth are responsible for each other, I urge Parliament to change the law and make it illegal to make a profit out of the lives of vulnerable individuals.

attributes.action: Allow current part time students to apply for the new part time maintenance loan
attributes.background: the new provision to allow new part time students eligible for a maintenance portion of student finance, is unfair to legacy & distance learners, currently if you are a part time distance learning student you do not qualify for the maintenance loan unless you have a disability & are a new student
attributes.additional_details: the rules for part time maintenance loans need to be standardised across the board and student who are currently 1 or 2 years into their degree should be treated equally with those who are just applying to start their degree.  additionally only part time distance learners who are disabled are eligible for the maintenance loan, i propose that the rules are brought in line across the board and made available to all students without discrimination to existing students.

attributes.action: Ensure Small/Medium Businesses have access to funds promised on Private Jobs
attributes.background: After a string of unpaid invoices from clients and going down the route of small claims to no success and no one to be held accountable, I propose the government put in a system similar to : DPS for housing, in which Clients must commit allotted funds to a independent body to hold a TPS
attributes.additional_details:
Trade Protection Scheme- Having an Independent body holding funds until works are complete will ensure payment is guaranteed to the Trades, no risk of coming out empty handed after a long small claims route. If works are agreed, the agreed upon fee must be placed into holding before Works are to proceed to ensure Client has "put their money where their mouth is".

If terms are not agreed upon a mediation route is put in place to resolve, even if the court route is taken this will ensure funds are safe

attributes.action: Dissolve the Northern Ireland Assembly with immediate effect
attributes.background:
The Northern Ireland Assembly has failed all of the people of Northern Ireland.
As a direct consequence of MLA’s refusing to take their seats within the Government the country is failing.
The people have a right to have direction and leadership which the current Assembly is not providing.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into new 2018 train timetables' severe delays and cancellations
attributes.background: Since the introduction of new train timetables in May 2018, services by multiple train opertators have been serverely affected daily delays and cancellations. Poor forward planning by operators has caused unacceptable inconvenience, loss of earnings and damage to regional and national economies.

attributes.action: Give apt psychological & CBT therapy on NHS to struggling with Asperger Syndrome
attributes.background: People with Asperger Syndrome and other conditions are being denied 1 to 1 appropriate Psychological & Cognitive Behaviour Therapy, even though they may have other conditions e.g. mental health problems. This has a serious impact and prevents them from leading a full balanced life.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS does not currently offer 1 to 1 talking therapies to those with Asperger Syndrome, irrespective of other mental health issues. The Government and NICE to ensure that those in need, requiring such appropriate talking therapies are treated equally to those requiring an operation. The requirement to be deemed as appropriate by the patient and/or a Health Professional/Clinician and/or Social Workers. Those with Asperger Syndrome when needed, be able to access it in a timely manner, as part of an ‘Overall HOLISTICAL approach’ for as long as it is required to work through direct and associated issues, to a measurable outcome & life balance.

attributes.action: To make it illegal to walk any Dog in temperatures above 70 degrees Fahrenheit
attributes.background: Just being left outside without shade or exercise on a hot day can kill your dog! Avoid High Temperatures & Direct Sunlight anything over 70 degrees your dog is at risk from heat exhaustion. Dogs have fur and can’t sweat.  Dogs can only expel heat through their feet and by panting.

attributes.action: Reject the Brexit Deal agreed by Theresa May and reopen negotiations immediately
attributes.background: Theresa May and her followers have negotiated a very poor and unfair deal for the UK. Her misguided deal would mean Northern Ireland would have different trade rules than the UK (thus endangering the Union). We would also not be allowed to leave the Backstop (Protocol) without the EU's agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
This deal needs to be rejected by the British people. It does not allow us freedom from the EU and binds our hands. It even agrees to extending the transition period if agreement can't be reached! 
 
It doesn't matter what party you vote for, or whether you are a Brexiteer or a Remainer, EVERYONE who cares for this country has to vote against this awful deal + sign this petition. Read the deal yourself and you'll be shocked at how much sovereignty we'd be giving away. SAVE THE UK!

attributes.action: Introduce Knife crime awareness/first aid workshops into schools.
attributes.background: As I write this petition 119 people have died this year of violent crimes, a huge percentage of the deaths have been to knife crime. Children should be educated on the dangers of knif crime, the consequences of carrying a knife, more importantly what to do in a situation If confronted by a knife.
attributes.additional_details:
London knife crime unfortunately is spiralling out of control and sadly most effected are young people. In a recent report it was mentioned how Children may be more vulnerable to becoming a stabbing victim on their way home from school.

Schools, should tackle these issues, have awareness classes, what to say? What to do? When confronted by someone with a knife. First aid courses, knowing vital organs, consequences of carrying a knife and much more.

attributes.action: Ease the employment restrictions on asylum seekers.
attributes.background: Asylum seekers are restricted to jobs on the National Shortage Occupation List [SOL]; the reason behind their unemployed. The support they receive is inadequate for daily life [£5.39/day]; forcing them to live in poverty; relaxing the terms will make lives less vulnerable for those already in agony.
attributes.additional_details:
People seeking sanctuary in the UK could contribute £42m/year; if the work restrictions were non-existent. Millions are being spent to support destitute asylum seekers each year; this capital is possible to retain & make better use of. 

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-appendix-k-shortage-occupation-list

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/oct/16/asylum-seekers-could-contribute-42m-to-uk-if-work-rules-relaxed

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-45100120

attributes.action: Ban Recruitment companies charging a percentage of your wages to process them.
attributes.background: Some recruitment agencies charge a Fee for processing your wages.  They pay your wages to a third party company who processes them and pays the remainder minus 10-20% into your bank.
attributes.additional_details:
My Partner worked for a recruitment agency, they got him to sign a contract with a third party agreeing to the wages deduction.
He was desperate for work and signed, he then realised he was working alongside other agency staff who worked for a reputable company who didn't do that.
He was not allowed to transfer to the other company.
So effectively on minimum wage after deduction for processing he was being paid 10% less than the minimum wage.
This is a con.  It does not take much skill to set up sage or some other pay software,  They are ripping the low paid off and need to be outlawed.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees of Universities from £9,250 back to £3000 per year
attributes.background:
The cost of university fees in the UK are unacceptable seeing as public universities are financed by the government. 
It's not fair for students from low socioeconomic backgrounds who struggle finaiacially and students from higher economic background to be expected to pay the same fee of £9,250.
attributes.additional_details:
most uni's in the EU are free ,however, what we are seeing is that Universities are continuing to increase their fees and reduce the grants available. The saddest issue here is all courses cost the same, that means a degree in nursing costs the same per year as denistry. 
As a result it's making higher education more attractive to students who can afford it and making it more difficult for students from deprived areas and low income families make it to uni's due to the fear of burdening loans.

attributes.action: Introduce a law which makes it legally binding to put an offer on buying a house
attributes.background: Too many people in England now offer on multiple houses and then choose later on as to which one they want. This collapses chains and costs the time and money of other people trying to move house. This law could allow expenses to be recovered against the party that pulls out.
attributes.additional_details: A commonly cited reason by people who do not want to move is that they fear a chain collapsing. Creating this law would ensure people to only offer on one house and therefore only complete one chain.

attributes.action: Scrap free television licences for the over-75s
attributes.background: According to Lord Hall of Birkenhead, the over-75s consume many more BBC services than others, yet are not required to pay for a television licence. This means households that are not eligible for a free licence are being forced to subsidise the over-75s which amounts to age discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: According to TV Licensing there were 4,455,000 over-75s licences in force in 2017. At the current cost of £150.50 per licence, this represents a total cost of £670 million that is covered by households that pay for a television licence.

attributes.action: Criminal Record checks on drivers of taxis and private hire a legal requirement.
attributes.background: Currently no legal requirement only recommendations. There should be mandatory checks in place as a minimum requirement. Licences should be removed from those found to have violent or sexual convictions. We have a duty to protect women, children and the vulnerable and less able.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers of taxis and private hire vehicles are currently allowed to keep their licences and continue to work even if they have criminal convictions.

attributes.action: Create a UK group to design, construct and operate UK nuclear power stations
attributes.background: 51% of all electricity generated in UK is by Gas and Coal powered stations. 21% is generated by old Nuclear plants. We need to replace these with new nuclear power stations. I believe that the UK should design, develop, construct and operate these with UK skills by creating a UK Nuclear Power Group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government should create a UK Nuclear Power Group to manage, design, develop, construct and operate the new Nuclear power stations required for our UK national electricity grid. 
A UK group would not only create thousands of jobs in the UK, using the skills that are developed in the UK and ensure the security of the electric network remained in our control.

attributes.action: We want the Government to Stop the unjustified rise in the cost of funerals.
attributes.background: The Government needs to bring into force regulations to limit the exorbitant cost of Funerals & Cremations.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all unpaid carers receive appropriate training
attributes.background: Adult unpaid carers save the UK economy billions of pounds each year and despite being under supported, carers are delivering cost effective day to day invaluable care and support which for most carers becomes a full time job. Carers should have a legal right to receive appropriate ongoing training
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities are charged with supporting unpaid carers under the care act. Local authorities already ensure regular routine training and support packages to other carers, I.E. foster carers, with a dedicated support team which is made available 24/7. Local authorities should be legally bound to manage, support, provide and ensure ongoing training for unpaid carers. Without certified training, unpaid carers are being left vulnerable, unprotected and isolated.

attributes.action: Require MPs to give a full explanation when they refuse to represent you.
attributes.background: MP can refuse to represent constituents and choose not to reply to any form of communication unless legally obligated eg subject access request. They do not need to give an explanation, it leaves constituents cut off from all lines of communication if they wish to ask questions of their government.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no way to challenge their decision. 

Apparently it’s an MP’s democratic right to not represent you or give an explanation which I find utterly ridiculous as they are there to hold the government accountable. 

This ability that MPs have to cut off constituents from questioning their government is wholly unacceptable. The rules should be changed so they have to give an explanation.

attributes.action: Make detentions in schools illegal if the parent's do not give consent.
attributes.background: I believe after-school detentions of students without parental consent should be banned because it is unfair to the parents if they have something planned and occasionally schools give detentions in poor judgement so I think its important to show the parent's opinion on the matter.

attributes.action: Add electric pet containment systems (‘invisible fences’) to the e-collar ban.
attributes.background:
The recent e-collar ban is fundamentally flawed in still permitting use of electric containment systems which make similar use of the fear- and pain-based so-called ‘training aid’. 
‘Invisible fences’ inflict the same aversive stimulus on pets, scientifically proven to negatively affect welfare.

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: Close the legal loopholes in the High Hedges legislation
attributes.background: Part 8 of the Anti-Social Behaviour Act 2003 introduced legislation to combat the scourge of fast-growing evergreens like Leylandii which, when planted in a line as a hedge has blighted the lives of those living in neighbouring properties.
attributes.additional_details: A high hedge is defined as two or more evergreens, more that 2m tall planted in a line and where the branches meet so as to provide a barrier to light. Enforcement of high hedges legislation is the responsibility of councils.  However, the legislation does not cover individual trees and therefore people are merely cutting gaps in their hedges so that the former hedge becomes a line of individual trees which despite being large, cannot be dealt with by councils under the high hedges legislation.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. It’s a choice people have.

attributes.action: School should start at 10am as teenagers are too tired
attributes.background: Teenagers are so tired due to having to wake up very early to get to school. The Government should require secondary schools to start later, which will lead to increased productivity at school.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people who kill others and rape children.
attributes.background: Many rapists go into prison and then come out to commit the same crime which is a massive issue with the system today many rape victims feel scared their rapist will try to attack them again. These people who commit these crimes shouldn't be allowed back into society.

attributes.action: Increase NHS budgets to help acid attack victims
attributes.background: Acid Attack victims face not only physical pain but also mental trauma that should be urgently helped. This can happen if the NHS budget increases so that there are more facilities available for this kind of treatment as the budget cuts to the NHS could hinder these emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: Victims of this heinous crime have to wait due to the lack of facilities to help them because of the NHS budget cut that makes it harder to treat them. Victims have to wait for longer periods of time that could take up to months or even years to book for their own appointments which should not be happening.

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on the Membership of NATO.
attributes.background: The British public should have an opportunity to determine whether the country should play a role in the future in the The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
attributes.additional_details: NATO was founded in 1949 by the United States as a military alliance between western nations to oppose the Soviet Union and serve a purpose in defending the west against the eastern block. However, today NATO is now a cold war relic. Britain should take control over its military affairs and its foreign policy to prevent the country from getting involved in wars.  We should follow our own operations rather than following NATO.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: Exempt animals purchased from a rescue centre from VAT on vets bills
attributes.background: To discourage unnecessary breeding of animals which are over represented in rescue centres, I am asking that any animal purchased from a rescue centre should be exempt from the 20% VAT on vets’s bills and a corresponding reduction in their insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details:
This would encourage people to buy from rescue centres and discourage the breeding purely for money of those breeds which are over represented in rescue centres.
Owners would register proof of purchase from a recognised rescue centre with their vet and have their record marked as exempt from VAT.

attributes.action: Introduce unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives
attributes.background: My mother at the beginning of 2018 became seriously ill, and was admitted to hospital. Work was very good about it and gave me compassionate leave so I could go and see her
attributes.additional_details:
6/8/2018 I was told mum had only days left to live, but I was told I couldn’t have compassionate leave as I was not entitled to any and would have to phone in sick. 

I think it’s disrespectful not to be given compassionate leave for a dying relative, my mum passed that week. And basically lost two weeks wages. I think this is wrong for anyone to go through.

Unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives, would solve this issue for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Make it the law that truck  drivers have air con in their sleeping areas.
attributes.background: My son is a truck driver and he all his colleagues are really feeling unsafe in this heat. Currently company owners do not have to ensure the sleeping area is cooled. There have been reports of cab temperatures reaching in excess of 50 degrees. We wouldn’t do this to a dog, let’s not do it to them

attributes.action: Freeze Rent / Mortgage payments for poorly people who are not be fit to work.
attributes.background: People are getting evicted from their homes due to not being able to afford their rent / mortgage payments when they have a serious illness such as cancer. Sometimes benefits won't cover the mortgage / rent payments.
attributes.additional_details: Help sick people to stay in their homes by covering their rent payments in full through benefits or if they have a mortgage then freeze their payments until they are fit to return to work.
